title: Maternal and Infant Nutrition
requirements: For students in MSc Obstetric Care
description: The course enhances and consolidates our students' knowledge on maternal and infant nutrition. In addition, it updates and broadens the visions of student on current feeding strategies from newborns to infants up to first year of life.It includes:1. Global politics and national recommendations for maternal nutrition and infant feeding; 2. Cultural and epigenetic influence on maternal diet;3. Nutrition assessment ,requirement and concerns during pregnancy and lactation;4. WHO directions on Breast-feeding and local policies on sustaining breast-feeding;5. Assessment, diagnosis and solving breast-feeding problems;6. Pathological and congenital conditions affecting nutrition and feeding;7. Special nutrition needs in preterm neonate;8. Infant nutritional requirement and oral care during first year of life.Assessment : Written Examination
outcome: Students are expected to:1. understand global and national recommendations for maternal nutrition and infant feeding2  assess maternal nutritional requirement and give advice to mothers3. understand special nutritive and nurturing behaviour in the childbearing and infant period4. recognise pathological and congenital conditions affecting nutrition and feeding5. manage feeding problems6. explore special nutritional needs in preterm neonate7. facilitate mother to introduce new food to their infant

title: Clinical Leadership in Midwifery
requirements: For students in MSc Obstetric Care
description: This course enhances the ability and performance of students who are responsible to take up the clinical leadership role in the profession.It includes:1. Relationship between professional autonomy and status;2. Theories and concepts about leadership, leadership styles, empowerment and the relationship between the sexes, leadership and empowerment;3. Future directions in midwifery;4. Changing dynamics of HK Midwifery profession;5. Workforce planning;6. Quality and safety management;7. Roles of consultant midwife;8. Roles of Hong Kong midwives from different health care setting: HA and private sectors;9. Developing clinical competency;10. Managing complaints;11. Face the media;12. Medico-legal issues in midwifery.Assessment: assignment of related topic at around 3000 words
outcome: Students are expected tobe able to initiate leadership role in the profession. It includes: 1. Identifying relationship between professional autonomy and status2. Understanding theories and concepts about leadership, leadership styles, empowerment and the relationship between the sexes, leadership and empowerment 3. Developing strategy to develop high standard of professional midwifery care in one's own working environment4. Being confident and competent in handling difficult situations such as complaints and facing media

title: Advanced Midwifery Practice Series
requirements: For students in MSc Obstetric Care
description: This course enhances the ability of students in understanding and handling advanced technology used in obstetrics. It includes:1. Physics and safety of ultrasound scanning in obstetrics;2. Normal and common abnormal ultrasound features;3. Interpretation and management of electronic fetal monitoring;4. Most updated methods and clinical applications of fetal surveillance;5. Relevant anatomy and physiology of the female reproductive organs;6. Role of a smear taker in cervical screening;7. Managing abnormal cervical cytology and colposcopy.8. Critical Care in Obstetrics9. Clinical Pharmacology in ObstetricsAssessment: Written examination and clinical attachment
outcome: Students are expected to  be able to:1. identify relevant anatomy and physiology of the female reproductive organs 2. understand the role of a smear taker in cervical screening3. understand investigations, management and treatments of common cervical and pelvic abnormalities 4. understand methods and the most updated clinical applications of fetal surveillance5. interprete fetal heart tracing with appropriate management6. have a basic understanding of the physics and safety of ultrasound scanning in obstetrics 7. have a good master of knowledge on interpreting normal and common abnormal ultrasound findings8. have a basic understanding of Critical Care in Obstetrics9. develop a basic appreciation of important pharmacological terms, systems of classification of drugs10. understand approaches used in therapeutic drug monitoring

title: Project and Dissertation
requirements: For students in MSc Obstetric Care
description: The course is to facilitate students to demonstrate competency in understanding of research methodology and basic statistical analysis by choosing one of the following as their dissertationsOption 1: submitting a critical appraisal of a published obstetrics or midwifery research paper including literature review, methodology used, presentation of results and implications of the study with appropriate referencing , with around 7000 words.Option 2: Given research topic, methodology and data materials, to submit a dissertation which should include literature review, rationale and explanation of the methodology used, analysis of results and systematic discussion of the implications of the study with appropriate referencing, with around 7000 words.Option 3 : Submitting a project of a standard worthy of publication in a peer-review journal, The dissertation should be around 7000 words and include literature review, rationale and explanation of the methodology used, presentation of results and systematic discussion of the implications of the study with appropriate referencing.
outcome: Students are expected to demonstrate competency in understanding of research methodology and basic statiscal analysis by understaking a supervised research project on midwifery care.

title: Teaching and Learning in Midwifery Education
requirements: For students in MSc Obstetric and Midwifery Care
description: The course includes 2 parts: (1) Teaching and Learning (2) Public Health Education This course enhances the competencies of midwives in teaching or mentoring role. Students will learn how to design a curriculum and improve teaching skills by demonstrating a classroom teaching. By addressing social and cultural behaviours, students can identify maternal health problems and learn how to conduct health promotion programmes. Assessment: Presentation of a knowledge transfer topic which is selected by student herself/ Submission of a midwifery program proposal
outcome: Students are expected to be able to:1. draft a curriculum2. plan and develop programs 3. critically appraise OR compare various teaching and learning strategies use in classroom and clinical settings4. assess learning5. use technologies to assess, plan, implement and evaluate learning6. apply educational psychology in teaching and learning process7. identify maternal health problems8. conduct health promotion programmes.
syllabus: Web-based teaching and learning Design and production of audio-visual materials Become a teacher, from novice to expert Use of database/electronic resourses available in CUHK library Strategies to facilitate a competenc-based teaching and learning How to impress audience by your lecture Adult learning principles Teaching and learning strategies in classroom and clinical teaching Principles of assessment Assessing strategies and learning outcomes Construction OSCE Construction of MCQs Construction of SAQ and essay questions Reflective jounrals, group projects and assessment Case study and assessment

title: Professional Midwifery Practice Series
requirements: For students in MSc Obstetric Care
description: These 2 series are the contemporary issues that within the midwifery spectrum of care. Students are expected to synthesize the experience and knowledge of these areas and develop in-depth understanding of their own profession.(1) Promoting normal birth Part 1 will enhance students’ confidence and ability in providing midwifery care in a low technology setting without compromising maternal and fetal well-being. (2) Maternal health and well- being in the perinatal period Part 2 will update students’ knowledge in understanding the current community development of maternal and child health care in at risk population and the management of pelvic problems resulting from childbirth.
outcome: Students are expected to synthesize the experience and knowledge of these areas and develop in-depth understanding of their own profession.

title: Grief experience in pregnancy
requirements: For students in MSc Obstetric Care
description: The course is to enhance the competencies of students in counseling role.It includes:1. Biology of pregnancy loss (miscarriage, induced abortion, ectopic pregnancy, stillbirth)2. Psychopathology on grief process3. Theories of grieving process, influencing factors and appropriate interventions4. Physical and psychological impact to women after hysterectomy5. Impact of maternal death to a family and intervention6. Clinical applications and ethical perspectives on grieving counselling7. Signs and symptoms of burnout and midwife’s self care8. Improve skill in working with families during the crisisAssessment : Written examination
outcome: The students are expected to be able to:1. understand the process of bereavement2. understand basic interview skills3. apply basic core skills in a therapeutic way4. improve skill in working with families during the crisis
